sourcing.instructions: O: Purchase from chemical supply companies or online platforms like Sigma-Aldrich. Rb: Obtain from specialty metal suppliers. Se: Available at chemical supply stores or online. V: Sourced from metal suppliers or specialty chemical distributors.
steps: O: Purchase from chemical supply companies or online platforms like Sigma-Aldrich. Rb: Obtain from specialty metal suppliers. Se: Available at chemical supply stores or online. V: Sourced from metal suppliers or specialty chemical distributors.

1. Measure 8.00 g of oxygen (O) and place in a clean, dry container. 2. Measure 3.00 g of rubidium (Rb) and add to the container with O. 3. Measure 32.00 g of selenium (Se) and introduce it into the container. 4. Finally, measure 2.00 g of vanadium (V) and combine all ingredients thoroughly using a spatula until uniform.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 8.00 g of oxygen (O) and place in a clean, dry container. 2. Measure 3.00 g of rubidium (Rb) and add to the container with O. 3. Measure 32.00 g of selenium (Se) and introduce it into the container. 4. Finally, measure 2.00 g of vanadium (V) and combine all ingredients thoroughly using a spatula until uniform.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixture to a high-temperature resistant crucible. 2. Heat the crucible in a controlled furnace to 500째C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixture to a high-temperature resistant crucible. 2. Heat the crucible in a controlled furnace to 500째C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction of the materials.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool gradually to room temperature (approximately 25째C) over a period of 4 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace during this time to prevent oxidation.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool gradually to room temperature (approximately 25째C) over a period of 4 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace during this time to prevent oxidation.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible carefully. 2. Inspect for any irregularities or rough edges. 3. Use fine-grit sandpaper (e.g., 600 grit) to smooth out any surfaces, ensuring dimensions remain intact. 4. Optionally, seal the sample with a clear epoxy resin for surface protection.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible carefully. 2. Inspect for any irregularities or rough edges. 3. Use fine-grit sandpaper (e.g., 600 grit) to smooth out any surfaces, ensuring dimensions remain intact. 4. Optionally, seal the sample with a clear epoxy resin for surface protection.
